TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Operators extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides late-bound math operators, such as and , which the Visual Basic compiler uses internally.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class supports the Visual Basic compiler and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int CompareString (string Left, string Right, bool TextCompare);
.method public static int32 CompareString(string Left, string Right, bool TextCompare) cil managed

Docs.param: Required. to perform a case-insensitive string comparison; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Performs binary or text string comparison when given two strings.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class supports the Visual Basic compiler and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
When the Visual Basic equality operator is used to compare two strings, it passes the strings to the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.Operators.CompareString%2A> method along with a value of `False` for the `TextCompare` argument. This performs a case-sensitive comparison that is either ordinal or based on the current culture, depending on the value of the statement.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("do not use this method", true)

Docs.param: Argument values to pass to the user-defined operator.
Docs.summary: Executes a late-bound evaluation of a user-defined operator. This helper method is not meant to be called directly from your code.
Docs.returns: The result returned from the user-defined operator.

MemberSignature.Value: public static object IntDivideObject (object Left, object Right);
.method public static object IntDivideObject(object Left, object Right) cil managed

Docs.summary: Represents the Visual Basic integer division (\\) operator.
Docs.returns: The integer quotient of divided by , which discards any remainder and retains only the integer portion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class supports the Visual Basic compiler and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

Docs.param: Required. Integral numeric expression. The bit pattern to be shifted. The data type must be an integral type (, , , , , , , or ).
Required. Numeric expression. The number of bits to shift the bit pattern. The data type must be or widen to .
Docs.summary: Represents the Visual Basic arithmetic left shift (<<) operator.
Docs.returns: An integral numeric value. The result of shifting the bit pattern. The data type is the same as that of .

MemberSignature.Value: public static object XorObject (object Left, object Right);
.method public static object XorObject(object Left, object Right) cil managed

Docs.summary: Represents the Visual Basic operator.
Docs.returns: A or numeric value. For a comparison, the return value is the logical exclusion (exclusive logical disjunction) of two values. For bitwise (numeric) operations, the return value is a numeric value that represents the bitwise exclusion (exclusive bitwise disjunction) of two numeric bit patterns. For more information, see [Xor Operator](~/docs/visual-basic/language-reference/operators/xor-operator.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class supports the Visual Basic compiler and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
